#Text=Wikinews interviews Steve Kissing , independent candidate for US President
#Text=Saturday , February 16 , 2008

#Text=While nearly all coverage of the 2008 Presidential election has focused on the Democratic and Republican candidates , there are small political parties offering candidates , and those who choose to run without a party behind them , independents .
#Text=Wikinews is interviewing some of these citizens who are looking to become the 43rd person elected to serve their nation from 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW .
#Text=Our second interview is with Cincinnati , Ohio 's Steve Kissing , a divorced father of two who is a creative director at an advertising agency .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why do you want to be President ?
#Text=In a very real sense , I do n’t want to be President of the United States .
#Text=It 's not something I 've been planning or hoping to do .
#Text=( Though I have long-fantasized about " sleeping with " my wife in the Lincoln Bedroom . )
#Text=But I know , at the very core of my being , that true and dramatic change is required and that someone , a non-politician , must step forward .
#Text=Rather than stand on the sidelines and wonder why no one was volunteering to lead the revolution , I thought it only fair and responsible to toss my own hat into the ring .
#Text=I want to help bring about a true sea change , one that will lead to a better America , and a better world .
#Text=Specifically , I want to help lay to rest , permanently , the political class and establishment .

#Text=This blood-sucking behemoth , which many of us have resigned ourselves to living with , is more concerned about power than prosperity , more interested in power than peace , more vested in power than eradicating poverty .
#Text=Have you ever run for political office before ?
#Text=I have never run for a political office , outside of student government .
#Text=I consider this a strength , not a weakness .
#Text=We keep expecting politicians to bring about real change as it relates to health care , education , the environment and other key concerns of all Americans .
#Text=But real change rarely comes from our politicians who often seem more eager to appear on the Sunday morning talk shows than to get real , bi-partisan work accomplished .
#Text=This is also why one of my slogans is : " Elect a person , not a politician .
